intro: Piaranthus cornutus var. mennellii, commonly known as the Cape tulip, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that come in shades of yellow and orange. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and thrives in full sun. Its bulbs are adapted to store water, allowing it to survive in arid conditions. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and rockeries.
